p.s: Sir David Attenborough is an English broadcaster and natural historian and delivered his speech as a people's advocate, in the opening ceremony of COP26 in Glasgow.
It deals with a confrontation with a climate crisis and spreading hope to motivate the assembled.
He talks about how mankind used advantage of the stabilized earth which leads to the destruction of the planet.
Furthermore Attenborough solidarizes with the countries that did not cause the crisis but now are the most affected.
In addition to that, he mentions that countries have to work together in order to make progress.
At the end of his speech he states the importance of the conference and what impact it is supposed to have for future generations.
In order to convince the audience he uses repeatedly inclusive language to involve everybody and make them a part of his speech and that everyone feels individually addressed.
